property.name: author
property.configure: Antonio Yordan-Nones, Colin Cochran (contribuor Edward a lee)

configure.p: The StringMatches actor reads a string and compares it to a pattern. The actor outputs true if the pattern matches the string, and false if it does not.
The pattern is specified as a regular expression. For more information about regular expressions, see http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/extra/regex/index.html.

property.name: port:pattern
property.configure: An input port that accepts a regular expression, which is compared to the input string. The default is an empty string. The regular expression may also be specified via the pattern parameter.

property.name: port:matchString
property.configure: An input port that accepts a string to be compared to a specified regular expression. The string may also be specified via the matchString parameter.

property.name: port:output
property.configure: An output port that indicates whether the input string and regular expression match. The actor outputs true if there is a match, or false if not.

property.name: prop:pattern
property.configure: A regular expression, which is compared to the input string. The default is an empty string. The regular expression may also be specified via the pattern port.

property.name: prop:matchString
property.configure: A string to be compared to a specified regular expression. The string may also be specified via the matchString port.
